misconceptions.inferred_category_name: Assuming non-empty arrays / ignoring N=0 boundary case
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes the input will always contain at least one student, so it is always safe to compute the 'top student' as index N-1 and read from both arrays at that index.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: In Java, arrays have valid indices 0..(length-1). If N is 0, then N-1 is -1, and attempting to access names[-1] or scores[-1] throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. The code relies on an unstated precondition (N >= 1) rather than enforcing it or handling the empty case.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: Runtime exception (ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException) when the user enters 0 for the number of students.
